sentences.english: Breathe out through pursed lips as if you were whistling.
sentences.chinese: 从闭合嘴唇中呼气，就好像在吹口哨。

sentences.english: The Wang Shi lip Yi moved several bottoms, didn't talk, but the facial expression is aggrieved.
sentences.chinese: 王氏嘴唇翳动了几下，没有说话，脸色却忿忿不平。

sentences.english: His mouth continued to twitch unspeaking in nervous curls of disdain.
sentences.chinese: 嘴唇却一个劲儿地抽搐着，显示出神经质的嘲讽。

sentences.english: Mrs. Dursley sipped her tea through pursed lips.
sentences.chinese: 德思礼太太嘬起嘴唇呷了一口茶。

sentences.english: The young American pilot bit his lip, shaking his head.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻的美国机师咬住了嘴唇，摇了摇头。

sentences.english: Then the Mute Singer began to play his guitar, moving his lips with the music.
sentences.chinese: 沉默的歌手开始谈起吉他，嘴唇随着音乐张合。

sentences.english: On hearing that, her face went white to the lips.
sentences.chinese: 一听那话她脸色登时变得苍白，直白到嘴唇了。

sentences.english: The child puckered up her lips and began to smile innocently.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子抿了抿嘴唇，傻乎乎地笑了。

sentences.english: He kissed her on the lips.
He fixed his eyes on Wang Ho-fu's moustache in a vacant stare.
sentences.chinese: 他直瞪着眼睛，看定了王和甫嘴唇上的两撇胡子。

sentences.english: Then Dr. Niedenthal and her colleagues asked the students to place a pencil between their lips.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他们让学生们在嘴唇间含上一支铅笔。

sentences.english: She did all this with the same compressed lips, and the same stony look .
sentences.chinese: 她做着这些事情，依然是咬紧了嘴唇，神情十分严肃。

sentences.english: Kissing sounds, howling, and smacking lips.
sentences.chinese: 接吻声，仿狼嚎，吧哒嘴唇。

sentences.english: Gently run your nose and lips over her shoulders and neck smelling her. Say "Mmmmm… you smell good."
sentences.chinese: 温柔地让你的鼻子和嘴唇滑过她的肩膀和脖子。

sentences.english: Lips are thin and tight, black to dark brown in color.
sentences.chinese: 嘴唇薄而紧密，颜色为黑色或深褐色。

sentences.english: Her tiny, round lips were full like a tulip bulb.
sentences.chinese: 两片小而圆润的嘴唇好似郁金香的球茎般丰满。

definition: mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
the wing of the nose/ala nasi
